metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000494 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Uninitialized stack variable vulnerability in NameValueParserEndElt(upnpreplyparse.c) in miniupnpd < 2.0 allows an attacker to cause Denial ofService (Segmentation fault and Memory Corruption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libminiupnpc10 - 1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2
miniupnpc - 1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2
python-miniupnpc - 1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

miniupnpd - 2.0.20171212-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: miniupnpc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2').
miniupnpd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.20171212-2').
